subject: RE: [junit] JUnit 3.x and JUnit 4.0 in Eclipse
msgSnippet: David, Thank for the detailed help. I really appreciate it. I have tried to implement Junit 4.0 (Just included the jar in the Java Build Path, so now I have
messageBody:
David,

Thank for the detailed help. I really appreciate it.

I have tried to implement Junit 4.0 (Just included the jar in the Java Build
Path, so now I have all three , JUnit 3.8.1, JUnitX and JUnit 4.0 )

But I still cannot get the right Click --> Run As --> JUnit Test.



Here is the test class:



import java.io.IOException;



import org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout;

import org.junit.Assert;

import org.junit.Test;



import com.sc.logging.log4j.WmDailyFileAppender;



public class WmDailyFileAppenderTestPrivateMethods {



String fileName = "./log/testWmTimedFileAppenderBase.log";



String datePattern = "'.'yyyy-MM-dd-HH-mm";



PatternLayout layout = new PatternLayout("%m%n");



@Test

public void testWmTimedFileAppenderBase() {



try {

WmDailyFileAppender wmtfab = new
WmDailyFileAppender(layout,

fileName, datePattern);

Assert.assertNotNull(wmtfab);

} catch (IOException e) {

// TODO Auto-generated catch block

e.printStackTrace();

}



}



public void testResetTimer() {



}



public void testClearTimer() {



}



public void testRollFileOver() {



}



public void testCommonActivation() {



}



}



Thanks,

-Kamal.





_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
David Saff
Sent: Wednesday, March 01, 2006 10:32 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 3.x and JUnit 4.0 in Eclipse



Kamal,

Yes, this is possible with Eclipse 3.1 and above. For example:

@RunWith(Suite.class)
@SuiteClasses(ATest.class, BTest.class)
public class AllTests {
public static Test suite() {
return new JUnit4TestAdapter(AllTests.class);
}
}

public class ATest extends TestCase {
public void testFoo() {...}
public void testBar() {...}
}

public class BTest {
@Test public void foo() {...}
@Test public void bar() {...}
}

Let me know if this helps,

David Saff

Kamal Ahmed wrote:
>
> Hi,
> Is it possible to have BOTH Junit 3.x and 4.0 coexist in eclipse and use
> @Test , and also the conventional Junit test cases? If this is possible,
> then what exactly do I need to do in eclipse in order to achieve this?
> Thanks,
> -Kamal.
>
